title: Drag & Resize Dashboard
description:
Design a customizable dashboard made of widgets that the user can rearrange and resize. Widgets live on a grid layout, can be dragged to reorder/change position, and resized via handles. The dashboard layout is persisted (e.g. localStorage snapshot) so the user sees the same configuration on reload.

Key considerations:
- Drag & drop architecture for widgets (pointer / mouse / touch support).
- Grid-based layout for positioning (rows/columns, collision handling, snap-to-grid behavior).
- Resize handles per widget (update width/height while respecting min/max constraints).
- Re-render optimization so dragging/resizing feels smooth (60 FPS target) even with many widgets.
- Saving and restoring layout snapshots (positions, sizes, widget types) from localStorage.

You should be prepared to talk about: how the layout engine works (grid model, collision resolution, snapping rules), how to keep the drag/resizing interaction smooth (requestAnimationFrame, lightweight DOM updates, minimizing React/Angular re-renders), and how to avoid performance issues on large dashboards (many widgets) while still persisting configuration reliably.
